metadata.title: CVE-2023-25193 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
hb-ot-layout-gsubgpos.hh in HarfBuzz through 6.0.0 allows attackers totrigger O(n^2) growth via consecutive marks during the process of lookingback for base glyphs when attaching marks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-harfbuzz-0.0 - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.2
libharfbuzz-bin - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.2
libharfbuzz-gobject0 - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.2
libharfbuzz-icu0 - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.2
libharfbuzz0b - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04
No subscription required

openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
openjdk-17-source - 17.0.8+7-1~22.04
No subscription required

openjdk-21-demo - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
openjdk-21-jdk - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
openjdk-21-jdk-headless - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
openjdk-21-jre - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
openjdk-21-jre-headless - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
openjdk-21-jre-zero - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
openjdk-21-source - 21.0.1+12-2~22.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: harfbuzz package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.4-1ubuntu3.2').
openjdk-lts package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.0.20+8-1ubuntu1~22.04').
openjdk-17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.0.8+7-1~22.04').
openjdk-18: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by openjdk-19').
openjdk-19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no longer supported by upstream').
openjdk-21 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '21.0.1+12-2~22.04').
